author: Staff Reporter
text:
Electrical short circuit is suspected to have been the cause

The remains of a house at Rangasamy Nagar at Nonankuppam in Puducherry, where 11 huts were gutted in a fire accident on Friday. —Photo: S.S. Kumar

As many as 11 thatched huts were gutted in a fire accident at NR Nagar in Nonankuppam near here on Friday. Property worth several lakhs of rupees was gutted in the fire. However, no loss of life was reported in the incident.

Police sources said the fire was first noticed in the thatched house of Govindammal located at sixth cross street at around 11.30 a.m. Aided by strong winds, the fire engulfed the houses in the fifth cross street. On noticing the flames, the hut dwellers ran helter-skelter leaving behind their valuables in their homes.

An LPG cylinder also burst and in the impact the flames spread fast razing nearly 11 houses. On information, fire tenders from Puducherry rushed to the spot and doused the flames after battling for two hours. An electrical short circuit is suspected to have been the cause. The cause would be ascertained only after a thorough investigation, police said.
title: 11 huts gutted in fire
